item.title: Crepant resolution conjecture for Donaldson-Thomas invariants
item.description:
The crepant resolution conjecture for Donaldson-Thomas invariants is a statement about the enumerative geometry of two related geometries. It relates the Donaldson-Thomas generating series of a certain type of threedimensional Calabi-Yau orbifold $\mathcal{X}$ to that of a particular crepant resolution $Y$ of its coarse moduli space $X$.

Here is a nice poster I made about this conjecture for the British Algebraic Geometry (BrAG) conference held in Cambridge, from 11 to 13 September 2017. It contains two results:

  1. The example shows that analytic continuation of the generating series is required for the conjecture to hold. This seems to be a new phenomenon in the DT-world.
  2. I have proven a nice formula in a motivic Hall algebra relating the Hilbert scheme of curves on the resolution to the Hilbert scheme of curves on the orbifold.

At the moment, JÃ¸rgen Rennemo, John Calabrese and I have joined forces to complete the proof of the conjecture. It turns out the underlying statement is an equality of rational functions, after a change of variables. The conjecture follows by expanding this rational function about different points. This requires some clever use of wallcrossing in the Hall algebra.
